bug.short_desc: destination imapd crash in xfer on 2.4.5 murder

long_desc.thetext:
Trying to xfer a user from source X to destination Y regularly (1 in 3 times?) causes the Y imapd to die. Syslog is either:
...signaled to death by 6, or ...signaled to death by 11.
I can't see a pattern. This ends up with `ctl_mboxlist -m -w' on both X and Y claiming they have the mailbox! Thus http://bugzilla.cyrusimap.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3367, now fixed.
This is a replicated murder system, with the auto-{sieve,create} patches installed. It's RHES 5, cyrus compiled from source.
I worry there's some corruption in the mboxlist or somewhere.... Here's a backtrace:
Core was generated by `imapd'. Program terminated with signal 6, Aborted. #0 0x00b85410 in __kernel_vsyscall () (gdb) back #0 0x00b85410 in __kernel_vsyscall () #1 0x005f0df0 in raise () from /lib/libc.so.6 #2 0x005f2701 in abort () from /lib/libc.so.6 #3 0x0062928b in __libc_message () from /lib/libc.so.6 #4 0x00632601 in _int_malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #5 0x00633e97 in malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #6 0x080c5f42 in xmalloc (size=35) at xmalloc.c:57 #7 0x0807d143 in mboxlist_makeentry (mbtype=0, part=0x81db200 "spool", acl=0x88c6cd0 "") at mboxlist.c:129 #8 0x0807e5c2 in mboxlist_setacl (name=0xbfd6e834 "user.hy8chan.Trash", identifier=0x88c8d18 "hy8chan", rights=0x0, isadmin=1, userid=0x88c5d30 "murder", auth_state=0x88c6550) at mboxlist.c:1346 #9 0x08055c74 in cmd_setacl (tag=0x88c4d58 "ACL1", name=0x88c5568 "user.hy8chan.Trash", identifier=0x88c8d18 "hy8chan", rights=0x0) at imapd.c:6342 #10 0x08063230 in cmdloop () at imapd.c:1819 #11 0x08065108 in service_main (argc=1, argv=0x88bb308, envp=0xbfd72c6c) at imapd.c:885 #12 0x0804d65c in main (argc=Cannot access memory at address 0x375d ) at service.c:581
I'll keep poking, but it looks like the memory pool is corrupt?
gdm

3 more stack traces, just for fun, and because it caused me so much pain to be able to generate these!:
Core was generated by `imapd'. Program terminated with signal 6, Aborted. #0 0x00a73410 in __kernel_vsyscall () (gdb) back #0 0x00a73410 in __kernel_vsyscall () #1 0x005f0df0 in raise () from /lib/libc.so.6 #2 0x005f2701 in abort () from /lib/libc.so.6 #3 0x0062928b in __libc_message () from /lib/libc.so.6 #4 0x00632c76 in _int_malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #5 0x00633e97 in malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #6 0x080c5f42 in xmalloc (size=772) at xmalloc.c:57 #7 0x08073456 in create_listitem (name=0x0) at mailbox.c:118 #8 0x08078639 in mailbox_open_advanced (name=0xbf840244 "user.lm4thoma.Trash", mailboxptr=0xbf8401f8, locktype=1, index_locktype=2) at mailbox.c:834 #9 0x08078828 in mailbox_open_iwl (name=0xbf840244 "user.lm4thoma.Trash", mailboxptr=0xbf8401f8) at mailbox.c:888 #10 0x0807e3c9 in mboxlist_setacl (name=0xbf840244 "user.lm4thoma.Trash", identifier=0x89d1970 "lm4thoma", rights=0x0, isadmin=1, userid=0x89d2138 "murder", auth_state=0x89d2848) at mboxlist.c:1285 #11 0x08055c74 in cmd_setacl (tag=0x89d0d58 "ACL1", name=0x89d1568 "user.lm4thoma.Trash", identifier=0x89d1970 "lm4thoma", rights=0x0) at imapd.c:6342 #12 0x08063230 in cmdloop () at imapd.c:1819 #13 0x08065108 in service_main (argc=1, argv=0x89c7308, envp=0xbf84467c) at imapd.c:885 #14 0x0804d65c in main (argc=Cannot access memory at address 0x4017 ) at service.c:581
Core was generated by `imapd'. Program terminated with signal 6, Aborted. #0 0x004c3410 in __kernel_vsyscall () (gdb) back #0 0x004c3410 in __kernel_vsyscall () #1 0x005f0df0 in raise () from /lib/libc.so.6 #2 0x005f2701 in abort () from /lib/libc.so.6 #3 0x0062928b in __libc_message () from /lib/libc.so.6 #4 0x006315a5 in _int_free () from /lib/libc.so.6 #5 0x006319e9 in free () from /lib/libc.so.6 #6 0x08091cc8 in undump_mailbox (mbname=0xbfebd628 "user.sp2lee.Trash", pin=0x824da68, pout=0x824f2f0, auth_state=0x8251938) at mbdump.c:1153 #7 0x08054857 in cmd_undump (tag=0x824fd58 "D01", name=0x8250568 "user.sp2lee.Trash") at imapd.c:8047 #8 0x08064699 in cmdloop () at imapd.c:1970 #9 0x08065108 in service_main (argc=1, argv=0x8246308, envp=0xbfec1a5c) at imapd.c:885 #10 0x0804d65c in main (argc=Cannot access memory at address 0x407b ) at service.c:581
Core was generated by `imapd'. Program terminated with signal 6, Aborted. #0 0x00c35410 in __kernel_vsyscall () (gdb) back #0 0x00c35410 in __kernel_vsyscall () #1 0x005f0df0 in raise () from /lib/libc.so.6 #2 0x005f2701 in abort () from /lib/libc.so.6 #3 0x0062928b in __libc_message () from /lib/libc.so.6 #4 0x00632601 in _int_malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #5 0x00633e97 in malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #6 0x080c5f42 in xmalloc (size=27) at xmalloc.c:57 #7 0x080c5ff0 in xstrdup (str=0xbf8e3d34 "user.decowan.Deleted Items") at xmalloc.c:92 #8 0x080734b8 in create_listitem (name=0xbf8e3d34 "user.decowan.Deleted Items") at mailbox.c:125 #9 0x08078639 in mailbox_open_advanced (name=0xbf8e3d34 "user.decowan.Deleted Items", mailboxptr=0xbf8e3ce8, locktype=1, index_locktype=2) at mailbox.c:834 #10 0x08078828 in mailbox_open_iwl (name=0xbf8e3d34 "user.decowan.Deleted Items", mailboxptr=0xbf8e3ce8) at mailbox.c:888 #11 0x0807e3c9 in mboxlist_setacl (name=0xbf8e3d34 "user.decowan.Deleted Items", identifier=0x8430d18 "decowan", rights=0x0, isadmin=1, userid=0x842dd30 "murder", auth_state=0x842e550) at mboxlist.c:1285 #12 0x08055c74 in cmd_setacl (tag=0x842cd58 "ACL1", name=0x842d568 "user.decowan.Deleted Items", identifier=0x8430d18 "decowan", rights=0x0) at imapd.c:6342 #13 0x08063230 in cmdloop () at imapd.c:1819 #14 0x08065108 in service_main (argc=1, argv=0x8423308, envp=0xbf8e816c) at imapd.c:885 #15 0x0804d65c in main (argc=Cannot access memory at address 0x408e ) at service.c:581
BTW, the cwd of imapd, at least on my system, is whatever it was when master was started. No chdir! So if cyrus doesn't have perms there, there's no core dump, regardless of red herring ulimits.
gdm

Sounds like your init script needs fixing! Here's what we do:
chdir "$DATADIR/cores";
(it's a perl script that does the init stuff)
Where is your init script from?
.... back to trying to read the debugs!

I did some more poking around on this. There's 4 systems with about 25,000 accounts on them, and all are now set up to dump core in a cores dir if the wheels fall off. Well, everything works, until I do an xfer, then about 1 in 3 xfers die and dump.
Almost all the dumps are somewhere within malloc/free, and appear to be the result of calling an assert or something like that. This is typical:
#0 0x00b85410 in __kernel_vsyscall () #1 0x005f0df0 in raise () from /lib/libc.so.6 #2 0x005f2701 in abort () from /lib/libc.so.6 #3 0x0062928b in __libc_message () from /lib/libc.so.6 #4 0x00632601 in _int_malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6 #5 0x00633e97 in malloc () from /lib/libc.so.6
Is that a message going to stderr? That's set to /dev/null, so perhaps I'll work on catching that.
The ones that don't do the above ABORT (signal 6) die with a SIGSEGV (signal 11), which also implies memory corruption.
I tried running mtrace() in service_main() in imapd, but it doesn't seem to give me anything meaningful. Creating log folders in the config dir for a target account doesn't produce any output. Running with CYRUS_VERBOSE=42 doesn't help.
gdm

Hi Giles,
It looks like you have encountered a memory corruption bug. Probably the quickest way to discover these is to use valgrind. Here are some instructions:
1. Install valgrind.
2. Create a file /usr/cyrus/bin/vgimapd
#!/bin/bash
exec valgrind \ --log-file=/tmp/valgrind.log.%p \ --leak-check=full \ --track-fds=yes \ $(dirname $0)/${0##*/vg} "$@"
3. # chmod +x /usr/cyrus/bin/vgimapd
4. Edit /etc/cyrus.conf, change the line under SERVICES which causes imapd to be started, from something like
imap cmd="imapd -C /etc/imapd.conf -t 600" ...
to
imap cmd="vgimapd -C /etc/imapd.conf -t 600" ... ^^
6. Restart cyrus
# /etc/init.d/cyrus stop # /etc/init.d/cyrus start
We'll need to see those logfiles in /tmp after you've hit the problem again. Oh, and it would be good if you built Cyrus with -g.
Created an attachment (id=1330) valgrind output from dodgy xfer

Thanks Greg! Looks like this is helpful. Valgrind is sure full of complaints. I attached a log file. Perhaps I'll attach another, under the theory that two is better than one.
Cyrus compiles with -g -O2 by default apparently.
gdm
Created an attachment (id=1331) Another valgrind log file from another dodgy xfer

Thanks :)
Interesting, I noticed those memory leaks in the SASL DIGEST-MD5 plugin the other day while doing unit testing on backend.c. I guess it wasn't just my test code doing something wrong interfacing with SASL after all.
Other than that, it looks like cmd_undump() is doing some invalid frees, which I'll go hunt down.
Created an attachment (id=1332) The correct second file this time: a valgrind log from failing xfer

Created an attachment (id=1333) Proposed fix for invalid frees in undump_mailbox
Hi Giles,
Can you please try this attached patch?

Created an attachment (id=1334) Better patch
This patch combines Bron's and my fixes.

I just xfer'd 10 accounts with the `Better patch', and no crash. ctl_mboxlist -m -w is happy, the mailbox gets transferred, and life is good. I think.
I'm doing another 90 accounts now......
g

I xfer'd 100 accounts with about 100 megs in each, then 1000 mostly empty accounts. No crashes! 3000 more small ones are xfer'ing now, but I think we can call this resolved.
Many thanks y'all!
It's 2:30 am here in frozen Canada, & I need to be up at 7:00. Brrr. gdm
Goodness - thanks Giles. I think we're nearly set for 2.4.6 now. One more blocker and we're good to go!
Setting milestone for the next 2.4 release
